title: Alexander Isak : Nightmare appearance as booed Sweden star fails to convince he fit for Liverpool debut
body_text:
Liverpool
Premier League ‚Ä¢ England
Alexander Isak nightmare as fitness concerns hit Liverpool as he‚Äôs booked and booed for Sweden
Alexander Isak failed to convince watching Liverpool bosses that he is fit enough to make his Reds debut as a starter this weekend after his first outing since his British record ¬£125m move to Anfield saw him suffer jeers and fail to convince while playing for Sweden on Monday.
The striker will hope to be in a position to make his first appearance for the Reds when Premier League football returns this weekend, with Liverpool hoping to maintain their 100% start to the new season when they tackle Burnley at Turf Moor on Sunday (2pm). However, with a pre-season punctuated by transfer speculation and no real opportunity to build up match sharpness, Isak is far from certain to get an opportunity to impress this weekend.
In light of his lack of match sharpness, Sweden manager Jon Dahl Tomasson opted to start Isak on the bench for Monday night‚Äôs World Cup qualifier away to Kosovo ‚Äì a game that witnessed the hosts record a 2-0 win, which has not gone down too well in the Swedish media and having been described as ‚Äòfiasco‚Äô and a ‚Äòpainful drag‚Äô.
With his side trailing and lacking a spark, Tomasson turned to Isak off the bench with 18 minutes to go, in a match that was his first competitive outing for some 100 days.
All in, it was a night to forget for the Scandinavians. Isak was booed while entering the field, though no specific reason was given in Fotbollskanalen‚Äòs report, though it may have been more to remind him of the hostile atmosphere the visitors faced in Pristina.
The report stated: ‚ÄúAfter around 72 minutes, Alexander Isak was substituted in, while Anthony Elanga left the field. The forward played his first match since May and was met with boos.‚Äù
The new Liverpool man was yellow-carded 10 minutes after entering the field, with Isak being cautioned after a melee resulted in players from both sides pushing each other after Muharrem Jashari was hurt in a duel with Anton Saletros.
The striker did, though, pose more of a threat than his teammates had before him, with the player wasting a good chance to score when he fired straight at Arijanet Muric after being played through on goal.
However, with just 18 minutes of football to his name since last season ended, it remains to be seen what sort of role Isak will play for Liverpool this weekend‚Ä¶.

Liverpool dilemma over Isak ‚Äì a place on the bench looks likely
Going into the latest international fixtures, Tomasson had vowed to use Isak carefully after careful consultation with Liverpool over how best to manage the 25-year-old‚Äôs fitness over the course of the country‚Äôs last two qualifiers.
‚ÄúWe will not do any stupid things with him,‚Äù the former Blackburn boss told FotbollSkanalen.
‚ÄúHe has not had a pre-season with lots of training and matches. He cannot play 90 minutes. We have a plan. He is smiling and happy to be here.
‚ÄúWe always have very good communication with the clubs. I have spoken to their manager. Our doctor has spoken to their doctor. Our physio Ben (Rosen) has spoken to their physio.
‚ÄúI am happy that the guy is here. It doesn‚Äôt matter where the players play as long as they play and that they are happy‚Ä¶ and he is extremely happy.‚Äù
However, the plus for Liverpool was that Isak was at least able to avoid any major injury scares.
The player is now due to arrive at Liverpool‚Äôs Kirkby training complex on Wednesday, where he will slowly but surely meet his new teammates as they arrive back from international duty themselves.
He will immediately get to work on his sharpness ‚Äì and will be keen to prove to Slot that he is ready to make his debut at Turf Moor on Sunday.
However, a place on the bench perhaps looks the most likely on Sunday, with Slot loath to change a winning team and keen to ensure Hugo Ekitike‚Äôs fine start for the Reds continues. To that end, it remains to be seen if Slot will turn to the player at any stage during the game.
But with three home fixtures to follow for Liverpool, against Atletico Madrid (September 17) in the Champions League, a Merseyside derby against Everton (September 20), and against Southampton (September 23) in the third round of the Carabao Cup, Isak will look to build up his fitness and show Liverpool why they were convinced to fork out big money for his signature.
